feed.title: Worship services - Trinity and Cores End URCs

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs
Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 15th May 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices before worship
Welcome, lighting of peace candle and Call to worship (Rev 22.2)
HYMN R&S 195 I danced in the morning
Opening Prayer Creator, Son and Spirit, we gather together, to seek your presence in our time of worship. WE ARE HUNGRY FOR YOUR TRUTH AND LOVE. Meet us at our point of deepest need. Connect us with the needs of others. Equip us to join in your creative work. Transform us more into your likeness. WE ARE HUNGRY FOR YOUR RIGHTEOUSNESS. We gather with people across the nations remembering especially the people of Zimbabwe at the beginning of this Christian Aid Week May their stories make us hungry for justice and impatient for change. WE ARE HUNGRY FOR YOUR JUSTICE. We gather with all of creation; with the mountains and the hills. We shall burst into song, with the trees of the field we will clap our hands. WE ARE HUNGRY TO PRAISE YOU. We gather in the name of Jesus, the Saviour of the world who teaches to pray to God as children to a loving parent, our heavenly Father. We join with all his followers across the world and down the centuries as we pray Lord’s Prayer
Psalm 1 (Good News version) Happy are those who reject the advice of evil people, who do not follow the example of sinners or join those who have no use for God. 2 Instead, they find joy in obeying the Law of the LORD, and they study it day and night. 3 They are like trees that grow beside a stream, that bear fruit at the right time, and whose leaves do not dry up. They succeed in everything they do. 4 But evil people are not like this at all; they are like straw that the wind blows away. 5 Sinners will be condemned by God and kept apart from God's own people. 6 The righteous are guided and protected by the LORD, but the evil are on the way to their doom.
Short talk: ‘Well-watered trees’
SONG Thuma mina (song from South Africa) unaccompanied 1. Thuma mina (x4) Somandla.
2. Send me, Jesus (x4) send me, Lord.
3. Lead me, Lord. Lead me, Jesus (x4) lead me, Lord.
4. Fill me, Jesus (x4) fill me, Lord.
Introducing Janet Zirugo and Christian Aid Week
Christian Aid video
SONG MP 806 Beauty for brokenness
Reading: Revelation 21.1-6, 22.1-3 NIVUK read by Norma Garden 21 Then I saw ‘a new heaven and a new earth,’[a] for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and there was no longer any sea. 2 I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband. 3 And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, ‘Look! God’s dwelling-place is now among the people, and he will dwell with them. They will be his people, and God himself will be with them and be their God. 4 “He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death”[b] or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.’ 5 He who was seated on the throne said, ‘I am making everything new!’ Then he said, ‘Write this down, for these words are trustworthy and true.’ 6 He said to me: ‘It is done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. To the thirsty I will give water without cost from the spring of the water of life. 22 Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life, as clear as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb 2 down the middle of the great street of the city. On each side of the river stood the tree of life, bearing twelve crops of fruit, yielding its fruit every month. And the leaves of the tree are for the healing of the nations.
Short Talk – God’s renewing of our world
HYMN TP 98 When I needed a neighbour were you there?
Activity – Prayers for others: leaves for healing of the planet, nations, communities and individuals.
SONG R&S 555 We are marching in the light of God
Blessing
Music and notices after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 8th May 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices before worship
10:20 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (by church elder)
12:16 - Call to worship
13:15 - Hymn R&S 47 O worship the King
17:25 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
20:23 - Reading: John 10. 22 – 30 NIVUK
21:40 - 24:50 - Talk for all ages Having to read a lot of CQC reports about various care homes You can see where people have done things better or worse than you Under the heading of care it often states that the residents are appropriately dressed - strange at first sight but actually is a good indication of care. Pulled up one time for a resident wearing a combination of garish clothes Humans are good at making their own minds up and working things out. People going to Jesus and asking whether he was the Messiah Jesus showing people in lots of ways how he loved them and cared for them Perhaps we need to look for Jesus in all things and follow the signs.
25:00 - Hymn MP 1008 The Lord’s my shepherd (Townsend version)
28:27 - 30:21 - Reading: Acts 9. 36 - 43 NIVUK
30:24 - Hymn R&S 277 How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
33:33 - 49:40 - Address The reputation of sheep for not being the brightest in the world Christians getting annoyed when compared to sheep Sheep seeking security of the flock and following the shepherd Knowing their shepherd Needing a leader, someone to guide them We are like that, needing Jesus Jesus provides the security of an eternal kingdom Christianity is not about Christians behaving themselves, it's about hope for those who have none That's us - filled with doubt and fear, having to cut through uncertainty and ambiguity to belief Terry Kelly - songwriter from Nova Scotia - In my Father's House When we are with God, he provides the sanctuary from life's storms, all we have to do is come inside with faith
50:09 - Hymn R&S 552 The King of love my shepherd is
53:34 - Prayers of intercession
59:05 - Hymn MP 13 All hail the power of Jesus name
01:02:34 - 01:02:56 - Blessing
01:03:17 - 01:10:15 - Music and notices after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 1st May 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices before worship
16:20 - Welcome, lighting of peace candle 17:52 - Call to Worship You have turned our sadness into joy. We worship you, Living God. You have restored us to life. We worship you, Living God. You have tuned our mourning into dancing. We worship you, Living God.
19:05 - Hymn - R&S 268 Jesus is Lord
21:40 - === Start of audio only section === 21:42 - Prayer of adoration and confession
24:10 - Introduction to our theme – called to love Last week I was on a supervision course online thinking how we care for each other and supervise ministers and Christian leaders in the future One thing was a daily check-in - how are each of us doing. This time we described how we were by being a kitchen implement.
28:43 - Introduction to the reading
29:43 - === Video feed returns ===
29: 44 - 32:45 - Reading: John 21.1-19 NIVUK
33:00 - Introduction to Love Wycombe Promotional Video 35:13 - Love Wycombe Promotional Video
39:50 - Song - TP 102 You laid aside your majesty Children and young people carry on their activities in the Meeting Place; we share a blessing: The Lord be with you and also with you.
44:09 - 45:46 - Reading: Acts 9. 1 – 6 NIVUK
46:17 - Hymn R&S Christ is alive
48:58 - 01:00:25 - Short Address Christ is alive, no longer bound to years in Palestine Today we have heard how the risen Jesus touched the lives of Peter and the other fisherman. Touched the life of Paul as he went with murderous threats to Damascus and changed his life Stories of transformation from failure - "they are fishermen, surely they should be able to catch some fish" Jesus shows them how to move from catching fish to catching people. drawing people into the loving grace and peace of God. Peter so full of regret and guilt after the denial of Jesus, that night must have been terrible for him Proclaiming he would go to his death yet when the moment came, his courage failed. Saul is asked "why are you persecuting me?" These stories are not just about a distant past, they resonate today with Jesus touching every place and person. How will Jesus touch our lives today? Dramatically, gently, mysteriously?
01:00:26 - Prayers for the church and the world
01:03:54 - Hymn R&S 243 Now the green blade rises
01:06:55 - Communion: we invite you to share in the bread and wine at church (or at home) united in the name of Christ.
A Prayer of thanksgiving and Lord’s Prayer Distribution of Communion
01:15:58 - Closing Prayer
01:17:07 - Hymn R&S 238 Good Christians all, rejoice and sing!
01:20:03 - 01:20:25 - Blessing
01:21:02 - 01:24:30 - Music and notices, organ voluntary

entry.title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 24th April 2022 led by Alan Yates

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 24th April 2022 led by Alan Yates
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices before worship
13:10 - Welcome 13:28 - Lighting of the peace candle 14:30 - Call to worship Psalm 150 1,2&6
15:16 - Hymn : R&S 234 - Alleluia, alleluia, give thanks to the risen Lord.
17:57 - Prayers - Approach, Thanksgiving, Confession & Praise - The LORD'S PRAYER
23:58 - Worship songs led by the worship band MP 881 Lord I lift your name on high MP 673 There is a redeemer
28:50 - WE LISTEN FOR GOD’S WORD
29:11 - 32:40 - Reading 1 - John 20:19-31
33:00 - Hymn: R&S 552 From Heaven You came helpless babe the third verse reflect the words of doubting Thomas.
37:36 - ALL AGE TALK – What’s in a nickname?. We often don't know what our nicknames are unless they are polite Our reading today from John's gospel makes it clear that Thomas has at least one nickname - Thomas the Doubter Thomas did a lot of courageous and resilient things but is left with the abiding impression of the doubter Not all doubts are bad Doubting the claims of cold callers from "Microsoft" Asking questions to confirm or quell doubts Thomas did the same - had doubts but didn't keep them to himself and simply asked questions to clarify Doubting whether God exists but doing nothing to test them, instead just living with the doubts.
43:24 - 45:48 - Reading 2 – Acts 5:27-32
46:01 - 01:01:28 - Sermon: - I wish I was more like Thomas! In all of our services before and immediately after Easter, there are a number of people who get a bad press for their actions. Most of the disciples and particularly Thomas get this. It's clear that none of the disciples came through this period with flying colours. Judas, Peter, most of the rest running a mile when the going got tough. So when Thomas comes in for criticism, he's not the only one who fails. In the lent readings this year, the words used to describe the disciples was "failed" Thinking that if God can work and live through failed disciples, maybe he can work and live through us Looking in the reading where Jesus appears to the disciples less Thomas and Judas and then to them including Thomas When Jesus appeared to the first group, he did three things - showed his wounds, commissioned them, and then breathed on them so they could receive the Holy Spirit. So even before the disciples could question who this person was, Jesus gave them proof that he had risen. "As the Father sent me, so I send you" - showing how God was dependent on the disciples to spread his word. That they had free will and had mutual dependency with Jesus Tradition has it that Thomas was allocated India as his territory to convert and the St Thomas Christians today can trace themselves back to Thomas. 5 points to close - Thomas is a clear example to us ass of how we are to fulfill Christ's commission today - When we look at the ragbag collection of the Disciples, it must give us confidence that we too can be His disciples - Do not be afraid of doubt and do not let it be a cover for dithering - Clearly express your doubts and share them in fellowship - Remember that our mission will be tough but with God's help it will not defeat us
WE MAKE OUR RESPONSE
01:01:42 - Hymn: MP456 Meekness and Majesty
01:06:11 - Prayers of intercession
WE GO OUT TO SERVE
01:12:09 - Hymn: R&S 247 Thine be the glory
01:15:59 - 01:16:18 - Blessing
01:16:43 - 01:21:49 - Music and notices after worship

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Easter Sunday Worship - Sunday, 17th April 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices before worship
12:48 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder)
15:00 - Call to worship with Easter Acclamation This is the Good News – the grave is empty, Christ is risen: He is risen indeed! Alleluia! This is the Good News – the light shines in the darkness And the darkness can never put it out, for Christ is risen: He is risen indeed! Alleluia! This is the Good News – once we were no people, but now we are God’s people, living the new life, for Christ is risen: He is risen indeed! Alleluia! This is the Good News – Christ is our peace, the indestructible peace that touches us now and lifts our hearts in worship, for Christ is risen: He is risen indeed! Alleluia!
16:14 - Hymn 232 Christ the Lord is risen today omit verses 4 and 5
19:48 - Prayer of adoration
21:42 - Introduction: ‘the great Easter Harvest’ So the long journey of Lent is over Overshadowed for us this year by the terrible war in Ukraine A wooden sculpture with a cross carved out backlit by sunshine and casting a shadow A picture of the open tomb A picture of a sunflower seed Growing sunflowers Linked to to Ukrainian sunflower harvest The reading today telling how all this began on that great Easter morning
29:09 - 31:09 - Reading: Luke 24. 1 – 12 (NIVUK) read by Jeany Bien
31:24 - Hymn MP 1105 See what a morning (Activities for children are available during the service)
34:38 - 37:30 - Reading: Acts 10.34 – 43 (The Message) read by Larry Ogbewe
38:05 - Worship songs - MP 14 All heaven declares MP 220 He is Lord (1 verse sung twice)
42:17 - 54:45 - Short Address: ‘Women, Wondering, Words, Way, Witness’ Each of the gospels bring their own angle on the story of Jesus, especially true as the story approaches Easter John with the upper room, Matthew with an earthquake, Mark's abrupt account, Luke's story of the great meeting on the Emmaus road Who are the ones who hear the good news first that Jesus is living - not the men who represent the patriarchy of the time, not the high priests, it's the faithful women who come to anoint the body Even now the place of women in the church is not as it should be The women are the great witnesses Getting caught up with political, military or financial power and not hearing the voices of women People wanting to be positive to trans-gender men and women whilst balancing the need to avoid belittling more than half of the world's population and ceasing to use the word women God has raised Jesus, praise be to our risen Lord
54:49 - Prayer of confession with the responses Lord have mercy: Lord have mercy. Christ have mercy: Christ have mercy. Lord have mercy: Lord have mercy.
57:05 - Song MP 387 Jesus we celebrate your victory
Prayer offering our lives for God’s work today
Living and Loving God, we come with our gifts to offer the praise of our lips and the service of our lives through Jesus Christ our risen Lord and mighty Saviour. Amen.
01:01:40 - Communion: we invite you to share in the bread and wine at church (or at home) united in the name of Christ.
01:02:50 - Hymn R&S 234 Alleluia give thanks to the risen Lord
01:06:04 - A Prayer of thanksgiving Lord’s Prayer
01:09:47 - Distribution of communion
01:15:29 - Closing Prayers
01:16:25 - Hymn R&S 247 Thine be the glory (version 1)
01:19:59 - 01:20:35 - Blessing
01:20:54 - 01:24:55 - Music and notices after worship

entry.title: Morning Worship, Palm Sunday, 10th April 2022 led by the Amersham Worship Team

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Palm Sunday, 10th April 2022 led by the Amersham Worship Team
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
09:55 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder)
11:27 - Call to worship
13:04 - Hymn R&S 208 All glory, laud and honour
15:45 - Distribution of palm crosses
17:40 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
19:53 - 23:58 - Talk for all ages – from the point of view of the donkey Imagine being a donkey in a village a couple of miles from Jerusalem Still very young Learning from your mother how to carry people and other burdens Being asked for specifically Setting off for Jerusalem Feeling the excitement Hearing the crowds All the noise and confusion A special passenger
24:33 - Hymn R&S 209 Ride on! Ride on in majesty
26:32 - Blessing as Junior Church go to their activities:
27:15 - 28:50 - Reading Psalm 118 : 19-29 read by Arthur Winning
29:03 - 30:44 - Reading Luke 19: 28-42 read by Linda Curley
30:54 - Hymn R&S 528 Jesus good above all other
33:53 - 47:00 - Sermon followed by time of quiet reflection Palm Sunday is one of the few stories recorded in all 4 gospels All 4 writers had their own agenda and were addressing different audiences As with Christmas, we tend to combine all of the stories together Luke says nothing about palms of the crowd shouting hosannah, he only records people using cloaks to cover the donkey and the path He misquotes psalm 118 with "blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord" when it reads "blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord". Luke has a theme of kingship in his gospel Jesus was coming with a mission of peace, not what the crowd seem to be hoping for, calling to be saved form the hated occupiers Jesus was coming humbly, in accordance with God's calling - what will they do with a messiah who comes in peace This was Jesus' last, loving appeal to the people as he approached a place that had a special place in his heart Does this event present any challenge to us today? Who can we identify with? Would we cheer, switch to shouting "crucify" in a few days? Would we join with the disciples? What would we have made of Jesus' tears and what do we make of them today As we follow the story in the coming week, remember that we don't have to wait until the end of the week, we know the joy of resurrection and can welcome Jesus as the messiah into our lives now.
47:20 - Hymn R&S 558 Will you come and follow me
50:03 - Prayers for others and ourselves
52:37 - Hymn R&S 261 At the name of Jesus
55:41 - 56:13 - Closing blessing
56:40 - 01:02:27 - Music and notices

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 3rd April 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
09:06 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder) 10:57 - Call to worship
11:29 - Hymn R&S 289 To God be the glory
14:57 - Prayer of adoration
16:50 - Introduction: ‘Forget the past – do a new thing!’ What new thing will you do, for the planet, other people and God? "Do a new thing today". Are we doing a new things this week, this Lent, this year? A new teenager New things in the garden A new pergola in the Cores Eng link up garden A new award for Trinity - bronze award for Eco Church Praying for a new beginning and new hope in Ukraine Hearts to write prayers for Ukraine
26:50 - 28:37 - Reading: Isaiah 43:16-21 NIVUK "Do not cling to events of the past, ...watch for the new thing I am going to do"
28:59 - Song TP 13 Be still for the presence of the Lord
Children and young people carry on their activities in the Meeting Place; we share a blessing:
The Lord be with you and also with you.
32:39 - 34:00 - Reading: John 12. 1 – 8 NIVUK
35:54 - Hymn R&S 474 Brother, sister let me serve you
38:50 - 52:45 - Short Address: ‘Jesus – the anointed one’ The journey of Lent this year has been overshadowed by the horrific invasion of Ukraine The world feels a darker and more fragile place So we turn to the story of Jesus that can speak powerfully into our situation today He lived in an occupied nation where a brutal regime imposed its power by force, crucifying thousands as a demonstration of strength People of faith questioned why God had not liberated them Injustice and corruption were rife Into this chaos came Jesus, his integrity shone through confronting the authorities, challenging the religious leaders. For many, God was a small tribal God but Jesus introduced a God whose love knew no limit Sometimes the weight of that ministry must have been too heavy to bear - sometimes he withdrew to Bethany to the homes of friends Martha and Mary. According to John it was here he was anointed with precious oil. In Luke the story appears earlier For John, the anointing of Jesus, preparing him for all that is to come happens in a safe space in the home of friends. Jesus stands up for Mary, refusing to allow her to be bullied by Judas. "You will always have the poor among you, but you will not always have me" Today, we need to stand up for those who are bullied or oppressed. That is what Jesus does for each one of us, for all humanity
58:58 - Prayer of confession Forgive us, faithful God, when we fill the rooms we enter with negativity, not warmth: Forgive us, and fill us with love. Forgive us when we justify our reluctance to give and share, blaming others rather than ourselves: Forgive us, and fill us with love Forgive us when we are slow to express gratitude, and take what we have for granted. Forgive us, and fill us with love. In the name of the anointed One, Jesus Christ. Amen. Be assured in the name of Jesus: Our sins are forgiven; we can begin again, renewed by God’s Spirit. Thanks be to God. Amen.
54:50 - HYMN R&S 308 Spirit of the Living God (sung seated)
57:07 - Induction of elders: introduction and explanation 01:00:12 - Statement concerning the Nature, Faith and Order of the United Reformed Church (R&S 761)
01:04:55 - Affirmations (by all to be ordained or inducted)
Ordination Prayer
Affirmations by the congregation
Do you, the members of this local church, accept and receive Linda, together with Abigail, Kate, Rosemary and Sue to serve as an elders among you? We do. Will you encourage and support them, and respond to their ministry acknowledging that it comes to you from God? We will. Induction Prayer Declaration of Ordination and Induction and Greetings Prayer offering our lives for God’s work today Eternal we come with our gifts To offer the praise of our lips And the service of our lives Through Jesus Christ our Lord and Saviour. Amen.
01:13:00 - Hymn R&S 373 Lord Jesus Christ you have come to us
01:16:25 - Communion: we invite you to share in the bread and wine at church (or at home) united in the name of Christ.
10:25:25 - A Prayer of thanksgiving and distribution of communion Lord’s Prayer Closing Prayers
01:27:53 - Hymn R&S 24 Through north and south
01:29:32 - 01:29:55 - Blessing
01:30:36 - 01:33:58 - Organ voluntary

entry.title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 27th March 2022 - Mothering Sunday

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 27th March 2022 - Mothering Sunday
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
00:15:15 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle Call to worship
00:16:51 - Hymn For the beauty of the earth RS41
00:20:40 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
00:23:38 - Talk for all ages
00:27:26 - 28:55 - Reading Luke 15 3-7 3 Then Jesus told them this parable: 4 ‘Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep and loses one of them. Doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost sheep until he finds it? 5 And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders 6 and goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbours together and says, “Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep.” 7 I tell you that in the same way there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who do not need to repent
29:45 - Worship song: When I was lost MP 1127
Blessing as Junior Church go to their activities:
32:48 - 37:35 - Introduction to Bible reading Reading: Luke 15 11-32
37:41 - 38:52 - Introduction to the Prodigal Son 40:20 - 50:59 - Part 1 the younger brother Tim Keller video
51:17 - Worship song Father God I wonder MP 128
54:52 - 01:06:23 - Part 2 the older brother Tim Keller video
01:17:00 - MP 1076 Jesus be the centre
01:10:37 - Prayers for others and ourselves
Offering Prayer of Dedication
01:13:57 - 01:16:50 - Hymn The lord’s my shepherd MP 1008
01:18:09 - 01:18:56 - Closing blessing and the grace

entry.title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 20th March 2022 led by Revd. Terry Hinks

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 20th March 2022 led by Revd. Terry Hinks
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
13:03 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle 15:18 - Call to worship (1 John 4. 7,9,11) Dear friends, let us love one another, because love comes from God. God showed his love for us by sending his only Son into the world, that we might have life through him. If this is how God loved us, then we should love one another.
15:52 - Hymn - R&S 30 Father we love you,
18:25 - Opening Prayer
20:38 - Introduction: ‘who do you say I am?’ Welcome as we continue our Lenten journey We are beginning to relax some of our restrictions Those at home won't see that we have tables out to help share our worship today Our theme through Lent is to focus on Jesus and to answer the question he asked his followers - "who do you say I am" How would you picture Jesus? At the last supper Leonardo Da Vinci (1498), Christ Carrying the Cross byt El Greco (1580), Christ of St John of the Cross Salvador Dali (1951), Light of the World William Holman Hunt (1851), The Last Supper by Stanley Spencer Cookham (1920), The Found Life of Jesus Mafa (1970s), Christ on the Tube
30:53 - Reading Luke Luke 9.18 – 22
31:55 - 33:20 - Talk and activity: Jesus today 3 names or descriptions of Jesus (1st Important in the Christian faith; 2nd Personal – your favourite description and 3rd a more unusual name or description).
42:28 - 42:53 - A Prayer to Jesus
42:55 - Worship songs - MP 375 Jesus, name above all names R&S 271 You are the King of Glory
47:25 - Reading: Luke 8. 19 – 21
47:59 - 52-55 - Talk: being part of the family of Jesus - keep practicing Does the reading sound harsh for Jesus' family? In a sense he was turning his back on them, challenging the concept of family as a small, exclusive group, moving to a wider family with God We draw back from that - blood is thicker than water. For some, family is an immensely enriching experience, for others it's the opposite Jesus says all of this has to be put in a new perspective - you are part of my family. Hear my words and put them into practice Jesus looks at each one of us and says those who have heard God's word, put them into practice Mothering Sunday next week Honoring those women who take care of us Linking to the whole church family across the world - Hong Kong, Yemen, America, South Africa
53:10 - Activity: making cards to give to members of this church family Write their name here and pray for them this week
01:04:21 - Offering and Commitment prayer Lord Jesus we offer our gifts and talents for your work today May your love and truth Guide and inspire our lives now and always. Amen.
01:05:23 - Song - MP 1076 Jesus be the centre
01:07:59 - Prayers for the church and the world using verses of the yymn - TP 56 Kum ba yah, my Lord
01:15:25 - Lord’s Prayer
10:16:05 - Hymn - MP 673 There is a Redeemer
01:18:32 - 01:19:11 - Blessing
01:19:25 - 01:23:33 - Music and notices

entry.title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 13th March 2022 led by Steve Burton

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 13th March 2022 led by Steve Burton
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices 13:10 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder)
15:08 - Call to worship 15:50 - Hymn R&S 38: Thou whose almighty word
18:30 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
21:45 - Reading Luke 13 vv 31 – 35 read by Sparks family
22:50 - 26:55 - All age Introduction We seems to be bombarded with special offers wherever we go If we like it, we'll go for it. Sometimes it's too good to be true We have the choice to take advantage or not Jesus' special offer to us is very good value - letting us live life to the full not just now but forever and how much does it cost us - nothing. Jesus has already paid the full price In our reading we see Jesus sad - longing to give his people the love they need to make their lives a whole lot richer Does it seem too good to be true? Are we not worthy of the offer. Why do many humans say "no thanks" and miss out on the wonderful life God can give?
27:03 - Hymns &Worship songs R&S 363: Lord Jesus think on me Purify my heart MP921
33:05 - Blessing as Junior Church go to their activities:
33:15 - 34:35 - Reading: Jeremiah 2 vv 30 – 37 read by Sparks family
34:45 - Hymn R&S 522: From heaven you came helpless babe
39:20 - 55:28 - Sermon followed by time of quiet reflection Supporting the national centre for Epilepsy in Chalfont Common Hearing negative talk about the development of the centre "we don't need any more of that sort" Most people are supportive and want to applaud those who help but this changes once they find out the halfway house will help criminals or the mentally ill What was once a good idea is rejected because it is happening next door What causes this - is it fear, for them or their children, is it financial? Jeremiah faces the rejection and wrath of the people but still speaks what God has told him to say Our Lord is for ever loving and gracious
56:14 - Hymn R&S 620: For the healing of the nations
59:08 - Prayers of intersession
Offering Prayer of Dedication
01:06:02 - Hymn R&S262: Crown him with many crowns
01:09:30 - 01:09:51 - Closing blessing
01:10:13 - 01:16:51 - Music and notices
With thanks to Charles Brewster our organist this morning

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 6th March 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices before the service
00:11:00 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder) 13:00 -Call to worship As we come to worship today let us say of our God: You are the One who is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust. Lord open our lips And our mouths shall proclaim your praise!
13:40 - Song - R&S 292 When morning gilds the skies
16:58 - 19:00 - Prayer of adoration and confession
19:04 - Introduction: ‘Into Lent’ Ashing services at the start of Lent "From dust you came, to dust you will return. Turn from your sins and turn to Christ" Think about names that are important in life today? Zelenskyy, Hope, Gary, Brian, Tracey, David, Greta, Pat, Tintin Our names are important to us The most important name and the answer to all questions in all age talks - Jesus Asking "who is Jesus to us and what does it mean to follow Jesus today?" H.G.Wells - "I am an historian, I am not a believer, but I must confess as a historian that this penniless preacher from Nazareth is irrevocably the very center of history. Jesus Christ is easily the most dominant figure in all history." The Son of God and the Son of Man Jesus wanted to be close to humanity
27:34 - 28:47 - Reading: Romans 10.8b – 13 (Good News)
29:30 - 35:57 - Song - TP 102 You laid aside your majesty, MP 477 - My Peace I Give Unto You
37:01 - 38:40 - Reading: Luke 4.1-13 NIVUK read by Lesley Bogart
38:50 - 56:00 - Short Address: ‘Jesus – Son of God, Son of Man’ It's a vivid picture and story of Jesus and the Devil. Wrestling with evil in the wilderness The struggle between the two has echoed down through history The struggle between good and evil, love and hate, life and death We see it played out in the messy world of politics and most recently in the situation in Ukraine We pray that efforts to arrange a ceasefire bear fruit Of course it's not just played out "out there", it's played out within ourselves Too often we try to help ourselves at the expense of others Even the church in Russia has played its part in a mythology that Ukraine is part of Mother Russia We pray that Patriarch Kirill will speak out against the violence. We are caught up in this, it's not just about others. We pray that further escalation in Ukraine can be avoided
56:02 - 59:55 - Worship Song from Ukraine “I will Sing,” by Maria Kuchurian & Diana Yakovyn
He is the One who lifts up and surrounds with peace. His love is great! I will hold on to Him. When the heart is heavy, He takes away the stone, Gently hugs. O my holy Jesus! I will sing, I will sing, I will sing to the Risen King! His hand is with me. He's near, here, I know I feel in my heart, I pray to Him! He warms with love and wipes away tears Loyal Friend forever. His name is Jesus! You chose me and set me up, You chose me, raised me up! You chose me and forgave me, You chose me, raised me! You chose me and filled me, You chose me, raised me!
59:59 - 01:04:22 - Prayer for peace in Ukraine The psalmist writes: “I call on the Lord in my distress, and he answers me.” Lord, we call to you in our distress. We trust you to answer us. We lift up the people of Ukraine before you…
Lord’s Prayer
Offering our lives for God’s work today
Communion: we invite you to share in the bread and wine at church (or at home) united in the name of Christ.
01:07:18 - Hymn - TP 48 Jesus calls us here to meet him
01:10:45 - A Prayer of thanksgiving and distribution of communion
Closing Prayer
01:20:20 - Hymn R&S 463ii Now let us from this table rise
01:22:50 - 01:23:18 - Blessing
01:23:46 - 01:28:40 - Music and notices
#Ukraine #HappyBirthdayGlyn #GuideMeOThouGreatJehovah

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 27th February 2022
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices WE APPROACH GOD
07:35 - Entry of the bible and lighting of the peace candle 09:00 - Call to worship – based on Matthew 5 and Luke 6 Blest are the poor in spirit, For theirs is the kingdom of heaven. Blest are they that mourn, For they shall be comforted. Blest are the meek, For they shall inherit the earth.
09:51 - Hymn - R&S 339 – Great God, your love has called us here. - 14:25 Introduction 15:25 - PRAYERS - of Approach, Thanksgiving, Confession & Praise LORD'S PRAYER - 20:27 - 25:30 - FAMILY TALK – In search of happiness Who knows Timpson's? A well known, family run business. Run with great integrity. They have just appointed a director of happiness. What makes you happy? Arguing about one's age? Family and friends, Lego spaceships, sunshine, sweets, ice cream, friends The next question - what makes your parents happy? A tidy room? Space and time? The real question - what makes God happy? We can get an understanding of this when we read the Beatitudes Those who are humble, not constantly taking selfies, merciful, not vengeful, those who work for peace, not trying to conquer lands
- 25:33 - Hymn 2 – R&S 512 – Seek ye first the kingdom of God. - 28:53 - OFFERTORY PRAYER - PRAYER for young people as they leave May the Lord be with you And also with you - 29:57 - WE LISTEN FOR GOD’S WORD - 31:39 - Reading 1 – Jeremiah 17 v5-10 - 33:03 - 36:18 - Reading 2 - Luke 6 v17-26 - 36:28 - Hymn 3 - R&S 586 – All my hope on God is founded. - 40:18 - 55:30 - SERMON – Jam tomorrow? An amusing story about the last hymn (All my hope on God is founded) This service was first used at Chesham a couple of weeks ago. Chesham have some masonry fallen off one of the towers. As the hymn was sung, most of the Elders were struggling not to giggle as the words "with what care and toil is build-ed, tower and temple fall to dust" rang out Do you remember more than a decade ago when David Cameron asked the Office for National Statistics to come up with a happiness index? The sermon on the mount and sermon on the plain having the same roots, extending into the Old Testament Listeners to Christ would have known the links and known that Jesus was referring back to Chronicles, Psalms, and Isaiah. Luke presents us with a choice - do you want to be a citizen of God's kingdom or a citizen of the Roman Empire (or whatever empire is around today)? Do you want to be generous or greedy, merciful or vengeful, peaceful or militant, part of the solution or part of the problem May we live full lives in this topsy turvy world - WE MAKE OUR RESPONSE - 55:45 - Hymn 4 - R&S 367 – I want to walk with Jesus Christ. - 59:32 - PRAYERS for Others and Ourselves. - WE GO OUT TO SERVE
01:06:42 - Hymn 5 - R&S 530 – Living God, your joyful spirit. - 01:11:33 - 01:12:11 - BLESSING
01:13:11 - 01:14:40 - Closing Music.
Worship Leader Alan Yates - Organist Angus Massie.

entry.title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 20th February 2022 - Compassion Sunday

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 20th February 2022 - Compassion Sunday
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
08:03 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder) 12:03 - Call to worship The Lord is gracious and makes things right: our God is full of compassion.
12:27 - Hymn - R&S 522 From heaven you came, helpless babe
16:35 - Opening Prayers Lord’s Prayer
19:10 - Introducing Compassion UK Good that we are focusing on Compassion this year, one of the leading Christian Childrens' charities Sponsors are connected to and known by the children they support Sponsors play a vital role in building the confidence and self-worth of the children Over 2M infants and children supported
21:40 - Compassion UK Sponsorship Animation Video
22:34 - Celebration Presentation Our impact, our gifts: more than 3000 hours of support and 1000 meals 25:31 - letters from supported Children - Mary and Christian
38:05 - 40:18 - Reading John 5. 1-15 NIVUK
41:20 - Song - MP 181 God forgave my sin in Jesus’ name
43:49 - 46:08 - Reading: Ephesians 4. 1-16 NIVUK
46:17 - Song - MP 1000 King of kings majesty
49:40 - 01:05:16 - Talk : Empowerment What makes you feel empowered? Think of moments that have caused you to feel confidence or courage to step up. 2 years ago I felt empowered by the technical team to speak to people in their homes - scary and creative! When have you felt dis-empowered? If Hayley were here she would share how she was empowered to help people Memories of a woman at a market begging people to help feed her children Becoming aware of Compassion through her church Pen pals to share stories and help Feeling the need to help but not knowing where to do so How to be part of a sustainable, God built change Empowering people to do it the right way Jesus is the original example of empowering others
01:05:27 - 01:08:14 - Compassion UK Video: ‘Least of These’
01:08:58 - Prayers for the church and the world God of compassion, Hear our prayer.
01:13:31 - Offering and Commitment prayer God of all creation, we stand before you now. We thank you for all your goodness. We offer our gifts and our lives, for the work of your kingdom of justice and joy. Deepen our care for each other, for all humanity and the planet itself. Make us channels of your love and peace. Amen.
01:15:06 - Hymn R&S 531 Lord of all hopefulness
01:17:56 - 01:18:25 - Blessing
01:18:54 - 01:23:21 - Organ voluntary and notices
#StormEunice, #Compassion, #CompassionSunday

entry.title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 13th February 2022 led by Rev John Mackerness

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 13th February 2022 led by Rev John Mackerness
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
08:26 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle
10:43 - Call to worship
12:21 - Hymn MP 564 Praise to the Lord
15:51 - Intro to theme – The story of Robin Hood Many versions of the story of Robin Hood Disney Fox through Errol Flynn, Richard Green A Saxon lord, made outlaw, gains the trust of the poor, falls in love, wins an archery contest, defeats the bad guys and live happily ever after until being betrayed by his sister. A great story with many changes over the times A love interest Robin and most of the outlaws are Saxons but all of the power is transferring to the conquering Normans. They unfairly use their power against the people We know that if there is going to be justice that the law needs to be applied equally to all Imagine you were a nobleman hearing the story for the first time, or a peasant or a priest. How would you feel about it? Positive or negative - generally the lower in the pecking order, the more positive When we hear the passage from Luke's gospel later, listen and imagine the different reactions that people might have
21:22 - 24:26 - Opening Prayers The Lord’s Prayer
24:27 - Worship song MP 1201 Longing for light
29:49 - Introduction to Bible readings
30:30 - Reading: Jeremiah 17:5-10 read by Norma Garden
31:54 - 33:47 - Reading: Luke 6:17-26 read by Norma Garden
33:58 - Hymn MP 16 All my hope on God is founded
36:57 - 51:20 - Sermon followed by time of quiet reflection We are very used to hearing a comfortable gospel message One of peace, a loving God sending his Son to forgive our sins, Jesus raising on the third day, how at the end of time he will return to judge the living and the dead. Most of it is fairly nice and cosy, but should it be that comfortable? From the passage in Luke, Jesus tells of those who will be blessed After the blessings come the sorrows: those of the rich, fat and prosperous. Those who laugh now, those who are praised by the crowds. Remember the story of Robin Hood, how you feel depends on where you fit into the story. If you are sorrowful, how do you feel if God tells you that you are blessed in the next life? The bible has a lot to say about justice It's God's word and we should love justice because God loves justice Racism and wider justice issues deny basic human dignity to men and women made in the image of God However, God is a just God.
51:27 - Hymn MP 1261 Brother, Sister, let me serve you
54:29 - Prayers for the world
59:34 - Hymn MP 77 Christ triumphant
01:02:49 - 01:03:34 - Closing blessing
01:04:10 - 01:07:40 - Organ voluntary and notices
Thank you to our Organist today Charles Brewster

entry.title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 6th February 2022 led by Terry Hinks

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship, Sunday, 6th February 2022 led by Terry Hinks
media:group.media:description:
00:00:00 - Music and notices
15:37 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle
17:14 - Call to worship (based on Isaiah 60) I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart: Before all else we will sing your praise. We will praise your name, God of all: We give thanks for your unfailing love and faithfulness.
18:46 - Song - R&S 34 Holy, holy, holy
22:20 - Prayer of adoration and confession
24:30 - Introduction: ‘ready for new challenges?’ Already in February, January has gone like a dream Thinking of new challenges like those faced by Isaiah or Simon Peter Are you ready for new challenges? A new system at work, GCSE choices, driving test, making soft rolls. Challenges faced by Nina Sparks as she gained a position on the GB para snowboard team, representing her country at the World Para Snowsports championships in Lillehammer Staff shortages in schools due to COVID Cancer Research London Winter run 2022 God's word of challenge in the bible Our two readings this morning will have those words of challenge God's challenge to Isiah, "who shall I send?" An all church challenge - walking with Jesus
34:26 - 35:42 - Prayer for all ages Jesus wants us to get involved in God’s story. So, I ask you: Are we ready to listen to Jesus? Yes, we are ready. Are we ready to learn new ways of living? Yes, we are ready. Are we ready to use our skills and gifts to help others? Yes, we are ready. Are we ready to say thank you to Jesus, for being our friend and Saviour? Yes, we are ready. Let’s say it again! Yes, we are ready.
35:44 - Song MP 3 Abba Father let me be
38:12 - 40:53 - Reading: Isaiah 6.1-8
40:55 - Hymn - MP 857 I the Lord of sea and sky
46:33 - Reading: Luke 5.1-11NIVUK
48:50 - Short Address: ‘called to go deeper’ Building and launching a yacht at Lyme Regis Circumnavigating the British Isles, beautiful and frightening The ferocity of the sea The story of the net washing, the teaching, and the huge catch Using his boat brought Simon into contact with this amazing man Jesus Ultimately the fish are not important as Jesus is talking about fishing for people Simon recognizes his own failures in the presence of this extraordinary figure Jesus says not for the last time - "do not be afraid, follow me" After the assurance becomes the invitation to become a fisher of people Are we willing to follow? To the table, to our daily life, to our hurting life. To draw others into the net of God's grace
59:48 - 01:00:42 - Prayer
01:00:50 - Offering our lives for God’s work today
Communion: we invite you to share in the bread and wine at church (or at home) united in the name of Christ.
01:02:09 - Song - MP 50 Be still for the presence of the Lord
01:05:16 - A Prayer of thanksgiving Lord’s Prayer
01:07:58 - Communion
01:12:05 - Closing Prayer
01:15:05 - Hymn R&S 261 At the name of Jesus (Tune Camberwell)
01:18:05 - 01:18:31 - Blessing
01:19:08 - 01:22:14 - Organ voluntary and notices Thank you to our Organist today Andrew Winton
